SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Class BatchInsertBuilder

java.lang.Object
org.klojang.jdbc.BatchInsertBuilder
public final class BatchInsertBuilder extends Object
A builder class for BatchInsert instances. BatchInsertBuilder instances are obtained via SQL.insertBatch().

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • of

      public BatchInsertBuilder of(Class<?> clazz)
      Sets the type of the beans or records to be saved.
      Parameters:
      clazz - the type of the beans or records to be saved
      Returns:
      this BatchInsertBuilder

    • into

      public BatchInsertBuilder into(String tableName)
      Sets the table name to insert the data into. If not specified, this defaults to the simple name of the bean or record class, mapped using the NameMapper.
      Parameters:
      tableName - the table name to insert the data into
      Returns:
      this BatchInsertBuilder

    • excluding

      public BatchInsertBuilder excluding(String... properties)
      Sets the properties (and corresponding columns) to exclude from the INSERT statement. You would most likely at least want to exclude the property corresponding to the auto-generated key column. A call to excluding() will overwrite any previous calls to either including() or excluding().
      Parameters:
      properties - the properties and (corresponding columns) to exclude from the INSERT statement
      Returns:
      this BatchInsertBuilder

    • including

      public BatchInsertBuilder including(String... properties)
      Sets the properties (and corresponding columns) to include in the INSERT statement. A call to including() will overwrite any previous calls to either including() or excluding().
      Parameters:
      properties - the properties and (corresponding columns) to include in the INSERT statement
      Returns:
      this BatchInsertBuilder

    • withChunkSize

      public BatchInsertBuilder withChunkSize(int chunkSize)
      Sets the number of beans that will be saved at a time. If specified, batches will be split into sublists of the specified size. By default the entire batch will be saved at once. Make sure this does not exceed the limits of your database or JDBC driver.
      Parameters:
      chunkSize - the number of beans that will be saved at a time
      Returns:
      this BatchInsertBuilder

    • withCommitPerChunk

      public BatchInsertBuilder withCommitPerChunk(boolean commitPerChunk)
      Specifies whether to issue a database commit directly after a chunk of beans has been saved to the database. If not, you must issue the commits yourself, if and when necessary. The default behaviour is to issue a commit.
      Parameters:
      commitPerChunk - whether to commit after een chunk of beans has been saved to the database
      Returns:
      this BatchInsertBuilder

    • withValueProcessor

      public BatchInsertBuilder withValueProcessor(BeanValueProcessor<?> processor)
      Specifies the BeanValueProcessor to use to selectively convert values in bean batches. If not specified, BeanValueProcessor.identity() is used. This basically is a no-op processor.
      Parameters:
      processor - the BeanValueProcessor to use
      Returns:
      this BatchInsertBuilder

    • withNameMapper

      public BatchInsertBuilder withNameMapper(NameMapper propertyToColumnMapper)
      Sets the property-to-column mapper to be used when mapping bean properties or record components to column names. Beware of the direction of the mappings: from bean properties to column names. Defaults to camelCaseToSnakeUpperCase(), which would map "camelCaseToSnakeUpperCase" to "CAMEL_CASE_TO_SNAKE_UPPER_CASE". (It would also map "WordCase" a.k.a. "PascalCase" to "WORD_CASE" and "PASCAL_CASE", respectively, since all characters end up in upper case anyway.)
      Parameters:
      propertyToColumnMapper - the property-to-column mapper
      Returns:
      this BatchInsertBuilder

    • withNameMapping

      public BatchInsertBuilder withNameMapping(String property, String column)
      Maps a property name to a column name, overriding the mapping generated by the NameMapper.
      Parameters:
      property - the name of the property
      column - the name of the column
      Returns:
      this BatchInsertBuilder
      See Also:
      • withNameMapper(NameMapper)

    • prepare

      public <T> BatchInsert<T> prepare(Connection con)
      Creates and returns a BatchInsert instance using the input provided via the other methods
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the beans or records to be persisted by the BatchInsert instance
      Parameters:
      con - the JDBC Connection to use for the INSERT statement
      Returns:
      a BatchInsert instance
